Super-hero-confessions is a blog where you can submit your confessions/personal opinions about any of the super hero movies, comics, television shows, cartoons, etc.

The confessions that are posted are those that are submitted; not the opinions of the blog owners. All the confessions will be anonymous when posted. Feel free to submit photos along with your confession if you would like as well.

If you want us to see a post tag it with either #superheroconfessions or #superhero confessions

body:
Little!Peter HCs

Thanks to @trufaxz and @peterparkers-sparkles for inspiration. you guys are the best💗💗

—————

🕸 When Peter needs help easing himself into little space, Tony will ask him how his favourite stuffie, a fluffy spider named Spidey, is doing and the boy will immediately start rambling. ”Spidey caught a super big and super yummy fly for lunch today and he is so stuffed! Look, Daddy! His stomach is bulging!” And just like that, the boy is settled into his little headspace.

🥦 Peter hates green vegetables. Carrots, tomatoes, cucumber, potatoes and cauliflower he can do just fine and even requests those sometimes for a snack. Broccoli, spinach, peas and salad he will not eat without a fuss. Tony will try to avoid the foods that his little one doesn’t like, but he has to eat some now and then to stay strong and healthy. And Peter will eat them, but only if his Daddy feeds him and makes airplane noises as he does it.

👐🏻 When Peter wants attention and closeness, he will pretend to fall asleep on the sofa. Eventually, Tony will see his boy curled up and breathing softly and with a fond smile on his face, moves to pick him up and bring him to bed. However, Peter can’t hold back his giggles and grins and Tony sees quickly that he was pretending all along. They go to bed after all, but in the master bedroom, and Peter gets the cuddles he needs.

🎼 What if Peter was deaf? Tony would learn sign language in 48 hours, less even and have all his employees and anyone that might interact with his boy learn it too. He would also work night and day on a device that could restore Peter’s hearing (if it was possible). The first thing Peter ever hears is his Daddy calling him ”my baby boy”. The boy is stunned and just bursts into tears of utter joy.

🐉 Peter is obsessed with the Netflix show ’The Dragon Prince’. He has seen it all over a dozen times and Tony is going just a little bit insane. The boy knows all the lines and recreates scenes with his stuffies and friends all the time. His obsession has also lead to some tears, however, when his Daddy had to break the sad news to him that dragons don’t exist in real life.

🔎 Sometimes Peter just gets bored, even with the tons of toys that any little could only dream of having. During those times, his Daddy will give him an assignment. ’Study an insect and find out as much as you can’ was one assignment and Peter spent all afternoon outside in the yard making a map of the ants’ routes. When he is finished with his paper, with a headline, drawings and listed fun facts, he will show it to his Daddy and get it graded. Peter always gets a 10/10 and big hug with praise muttered into his ear.

body:
12:43, Monday, February 15th

I was just thinking about how Peter Parker name his suit’s AI voice “Karen” in the Avengers movies, and I just thought to myself,

“if my Avengers OC has that, what would she name it?”

Then the funniest thought just came to my head

Peter: So, you’ve got a suit lady too?

Sophie: Yeah, what’d you name yours?

Peter: Karen. What about you?

Sophie: … Alexa.

Masterlist

I'm bored so I write about Tom sKe SkE Holland and Peter yEeT Parker

title: On My Own
body:
Part 9

(Peter Parker x reader)

Summary: Reader lives a hard life, jumping from foster home to foster home, only staying in NYC though. The reader is a mutant, no one wanted her, and it’s not like she could contain her powers. But in her efforts to steal a famous suit, she ends up getting caught. Her path going in a different direction.

Warning: Language, angst, fluff, violence,

Word count: 3K

A/N: Guys I feel so bad, legit I kept procrastinating this last part. But I finally finished the series, and I think I might start a new one but Tom Holland. I’m just so happy for those of you who actually read this series and enjoy it. Thanks for sticking with me :)

“Wake up!” You heard someone yell then you felt ice water hit your face. Your eyes snapped open, you vision was blurry and you heard a ringing. Soon your eyes focused on the man in front of you. “It’s about damn fucking time.” He said roughly, moving away to the door to talk to someone.

Your eyes adjusted to the dull light and that’s when you could make out the person sitting in front of you, also tied down to the chair.

“Tony?” Your voice was scratched but he heard you.

“It’s me.” Tony coughed harshly, spitting blood out of his mouth. “Are you alright?”

“Always. Are you?” You asked worriedly. Tony let out a half-hearted laugh.

“Always.” You tried wiggling out of the restraints, but they only seemed to tighten the more you struggled. “Stop moving, they’ll only get tighter.” Tony said.

“What? No we can’t just stay here!” You whisper yell, trying not to get the attention of the guy by the door.

“Well the more you struggle the worse it will get, just calm down.” Tony told you calmly, knowing if his words were harsh you’d panic.

“I can’t- I can’t use my powers-“ Your panicking.

“The cuffs are like the ones I have, they cut your powers.” Tony says.

“What are we going to do-your bleeding?!” You say panicked, your eye catching the gash on his arm.

“I’m fine, we’re fine.” He tells you.

“What?! Your fucking bleeding-“ Your sentence is cut off by a slap across your face.

“DONT FUCKING TOUCH HER!” Tony yelled as he struggled in the restraints. The man turned around facing Tony.

“What did I say about talking?” The man said with a smirk.

“I don’t give a fuck, I said don’t fucking touch her!” Tony yelled, words laced with anger. You moved your jaw, shaking off the pain.

“Your not one to make the calls here, Mr. Stark.” The man said as he held Tony’s face in his hand. Tony struggled in his grip, but the man didn’t budge.

“Leave him alone!” You yelled, making the man smile mischievously.

“Oh, your much like your father.” He said making his way to you. Tony felt his blood boil the closer the man got to you. The mans fingers caressed your cheek, you moved your head away from his hand in disgust. “So pretty.”

“Leave her ALONE!” Tony yelled, but before he could say anything more, the man held his hand up and in seconds another man that you hadn’t noticed before, came behind Tony, wrapping a restraint around his mouth. Tony yelled more but his voice was muffled.

“Silence him.” The man in front of you said, the other man responded by hitting him against the head. Tony winced in pain, and shut up.

“He’s pretty protective over you, ain’t he.” The man said his face coming closer to you.

“You needa mint.” You said, as your nose scrunched up. The man laughed, but slapped you across the face once again, this time making your cheek bleed.

“You should learn to keep that pretty mouth shut.” You opened and closed your mouth checking if your jaw was fine. After the man saw you were silent he moved away from you going over to the second man.

“What are we gonna do now?” The second man said.

“We wait for Him, he’s on his way.” The other answered.

Tony looked at you, eyes wide.

“I’m fine.” You mouthed to him, he nodded. But he knew you were far from fine.

-

“It’s been a week, and you still haven’t found anything?” Steve asked Bruce frustrated.

“No I’m working on it.” Bruce said typing on the multiple screens. Steve paced around the room, rubbing his face. Nat stood up from her spot.

“We’ll find them, don’t worry.” Nat said softly. Steve looked up at Nat the frustration building up.”cmere.” Nat said opening her arms for Steve, which he gladly took.

-two weeks and a half later

“Steve I’ve got something.” Bruce said as she turned the screen so Steve could see. “Its the security tapes, the truck left the city, it’s all the way up in Maine-“ Bruce said but was cut of by Peter.

“Then what are we waiting for!” Peter was sitting by Bruce his fifth coffee in hand.

“Hold on Pete, you need to rest.” Steve said putting an arm on Peters shoulder, but Peter just pushed him away.

“What?! I’m fine-“ Peter was actually fine. When he heard the bomb he ran down to the lab to find the guys taking you away and when he yelled one guy had shot him with a taser. But he was fine now.

“We’re not going to take you, we don’t know what’s out there and if Tony finds out we took you to something we didn’t know-“ Peters eyes were wide.

“I’m going whether you like it or not, I’m the only one here who’s seen how they look and I’m not going to just sit here and do nothing!” Peter felt his blood boil, his fists clenching. Steve looked back at the rest of the team to see what they think.

“He’s not a kid anymore, he can handle it.” Sam said shrugging. Steve turned back to Peter, looking over him. If he had to be honest, they were right Peter isn’t a kid anymore.

“Fine, but your staying with us, don’t go off on your own.” Steve said sternly. Peter nodded frantically.

“Of course.” Steve patted his shoulder once more and turned back to the team.

“Suit up!”

-

You woke up once again, this time after passing out four times. Both you and Tony were covered in blood, bruises and deep gashes littered your bodies. You held back the tears, not wanting to show weakness. And you knew if you broke down, that Tony would too. The only reason he’s still breathing right now is for you.

“Screw. You.” You said spitting your blood in the mans face. The man yelled again, punching your gut this time. You groaned in pain, arching forward.

“Leave her alone.” Tony groaned, it was getting harder and harder for him to speak. Unlike you, Tony was human, he didn’t have any super strength or fast healing, it was getting worse. The man got up fixing his shirt. He traded spots with the other man. And well let’s put it in a not so gory way, he had a sharp knife. 

You screamed out in pain, Tony closing his eyes shut as the tears fell from the sides of his eyes. He couldn’t bare to look at you being tortured. After some time the screams died down and both men walked out of the room. Tony finally opened his eyes to find you once again, fainted and laying your head to the side. 

“I’m sorry.” He whispered between sobs. 

Next day

You don’t know how much blood you’ve lost, but you know it’s a lot considering how light-headed your are, and the passing out. The two men walked back into the room, but they’re facial expressions were different then before. 

“We’re down to our last straw, tell us the codes!” The man yelled at you both.

“You mind keeping your voice a little down, my head kinda hurts.” You teased with a stupid smirk. Tony shook his head at you, letting out a sigh when he saw the man charge over to you. 

“Don’t-” Tony was cut off when the man held his hand up. He leaned down, his face inches away from yours.

“You think your funny, don’t you?” He said seriously. You shrugged giving him a sly smirk. 

“I’d like to think.” The man turned around looking at his buddy, then back to you. A humorless laugh leaving his lips. You were expecting him to slap, punch, kick anything, but no, all he did was put a hand up. Before you know it, two people walk in, faces covered in masks. Both men go to Tony untying him and taking him away. 

“Where are you taking him!” You yelled as Tony tried to fight them off, but the amount of blood he lost making him more weak. 

“You should’ve stayed quiet.” He said, walking out of the room and leaving you alone. 

The next few hours were quiet, but then you heard a sharp yell. Your head picked up, you heard it again and again. Tony. You winced hearing his cries and screams. You felt the tears running down your cheek. It’s your fault, it’s your fault. There hurting him. You heard various noises, but they all ended in his screams. And that’s when you lost it. 

You cried more and more, your heart clenching every time you heard his screams and before you know it your hands were heating up. With one more cry the restraints came burning off and you fell to the ground. You cried more, until your head finally came back. You stood up, holding the chair for balance. You took a few deep breaths, trying to calm yourself. But soon enough, you were back, lighting your hands with energy and blasting the steel door open. 

You walked down the hallway, soon hearing footsteps running in your direction. You didn’t bother, when you saw the familiar suits you blasted them, taking your time to let the energy enter there bodies and blow them from the inside out. You had no mercy and you didn’t care. The more you walked, the clearer his screams became, but then they ended. You stopped in your tracks, your heartbeat quickening. You ran to the door you heard him last. 

You burned a hole in the door, entering the dark room. The moment yours eyes scanned over the room, your heart broke. They had Tony wrapped up, standing up, as two men beat him and tortured him with tools. Tony wasn’t moving. You shook your head. He’s not dead. no no. The men came charging towards you. You took each one of them, dropping them to the ground and pressing a hand on there chests burning the energy through there body. the only thing you could hear was your heart beat. 

You ran to Tony, burning off the restraints, his body falling on you, you held him, laying him on the floor. He rested on you as you cried. 

“Tony, please, please wake up.” You were choking on sobs. Your hand stroking his bloody face. You leaned your forehead down on his as your tears fell on him. “D-daddy, w-wake up, I need you. I need you.” You couldn’t feel anything, only the shattering of your heart. “please.” Your body shook, letting all the feeling in. 

-

The team split up, taking different parts of the building. 

By the time they all got in, they heard blasting and screams. Steve, Nat and Peter made their way through the buildings. After taking down most of the soliders, they went to each room, looking for you and Tony. 

Not long after, Peter turned a corner to hear your cries. He ran quickly and stopped in his tracks when he saw you clutching Tony’s body. “I-I’m sorry.” He heard you cry. Steve and Nat stopped next to Peter, both their hearts dropping. 

Peter didn’t waste time running to you. Your eyes shot up, locking with Peter. Peter sat on the other side of Tony, his hand on his chest. 

“Karen check his vitals.” You continued to stroke Tonys hair, as you waited. “He’s alive, his heart beat is very slow though. We need to get him back to the compound.” He said quickly looking up at Steve. Steve nodded going over to Tony. You looked up eyes wide. Steve struggled to get your grip off of Tony, you didn’t even know, he needed to get in the quinjet, but you couldn’t let go. 

“Y/n let go.” Steve said, but your eyes only teared up more.

“I can’t, I can’t.” You cried, shaking your head ‘no’. Steve looked over your figure. You were broken, you were truly holding on with all your strength. 

“Peter.” Steve looked at Peter, nodding his head to you. Peter nodded coming behind you, tugging your hands out of the grip. You cried louder when you lost contact with Tony. Steve picked Tony up, as Peter held you back. 

“He’s going to be fine. Your fine. We’re here.” Peter whispered in your ear, as you cried. You continued to cry, until Peter picked you up and carried you to the quinjet. 

You cried more when you saw Tony being hooked up to multiple wire on the jet. Peter made you turn away, and soon enough the crying was too much and you fell asleep. 

-three days later

You groaned as you started to wake up, not in a hard chair, but a comfortable bed. Your eyes fluttered open, the sunlight’s streaking in through the window. Your eyes landed on Peter who was fastly asleep. head on your bed, hand holding yours. You brought your hand up, rubbing it smoothly through his curls.

Peter groaned, yawning as he picked up his head. When he finally opened his eyes, it seemed like you could finally breathe. “Hey.” You whisper, smiling brightly at him. Peter doesn’t waste time, leaning into your body and capturing your lips. You smiled into the kiss, cupping his cheek. Peter pulled away resting his head on yours.

“Hey.” He whispered back.

After the doctors ran a few more check ups on you, and made sure you were ok to leave the room. You had Peter take you to Tony’s room.

Your heart clutched when you entered the room seeing Tony hooked up to machines, his breathing steady.

“He hasn’t woken up yet.” Peter tells you softly. You nod, moving over to the seat by the bed.

“I’m just-I’m just gonna sit with him.” You say softly. Peter nods bending down to kiss the top of your head.

“I’ll be outside if you need anything. You give Peter a warm smile, turning back to Tony. You let your hand take his, smoothing your thumb on the back of his hand.

“I’m sorry.” You whisper, leaning your head against the bed, a few tears escaping.

-

You spent the next couple of weeks by his side, only getting up to use the bathroom. Either Peter or Steve would come by to give you some food, but you’d only have a bite or two. You spent most of your time talking to Tony, well you hope he could hear you, or you’d just be talking to yourself. You were trying your best to keep it together. There were a few nights where you’d cry because it was driving you crazy. You could feel yourself slipping off the edge, but Peter kept you up, and so did the rest of the time. But even that wasn’t enough. You don’t notice how much you depend on a person, until you loose them. 

-

You were once again, sleeping by Tony’s side, resting your head on the bed, hand softly placed on top of his. It was the middle of the night and Steve had tried once again to get you to sleep in your room, but you refused. 

Tony felt himself stir awake, his eyes slowly opening, still feeling the weight of them however. His eyes scanning the dark room, tilting his head a little, then landing on you. He felt his heart ease, you were alive. Tony couldn’t hold back the smile and the tears prickling his eyes. His hand came out from under yours, softly caressing your cheek, you sighing in your sleep. 

You began to wake up, you became a pretty light sleeper after the incident. You groaned tiredly, opening your eyes softly. As soon as you caught a glimpse of Tony with his eyes open, yours shot open. Your head picking up. You felt the weight on your heart being lifted. Tony smiled when he saw your content face. 

“Hey kid.” He said softly. You broke down, letting the tears coat your cheeks as you flung your arms around his waist resting your on his shoulder. Tony let the tears run down his cheek as well, rubbing your back. 

“Dad.” You felt the words leaving your lips easily, not forced or strangled. They were right. “Your awake.” You sniffled, as Tony picked your head up, wiping the tears from your cheeks. 

“I’m here.” You let out a soft laugh, followed by more tears. 

“I’m sorry.” You cried as Tony pulled you back in. 

“Don’t be sorry. Your fine. I’m fine. Your not alone.” You clutched Tony’s shirt as you held him closely. “I love you y/n, your my baby. You’ll always be my baby.” Tony said softly, as your cries eased. 

“Love you too Dad.” You replied. Tony felt his heart leap when he heard the three letter word leave your lips. You finally said it, you accepted it and he was going to be there. “Wake up!” You heard someone yell then you felt ice water hit your face. Your eyes snapped open, you vision was blurry and you heard a ringing. Soon your eyes focused on the man in front of you. “It’s about damn fucking time.” He said roughly, moving away to the door to talk to someone.

Your eyes adjusted to the dull light and that’s when you could make out the person sitting in front of you, also tied down to the chair.

“Tony?” Your voice was scratched but he heard you.

“It’s me.” Tony coughed harshly, spitting blood out of his mouth. “Are you alright?”

“Always. Are you?” You asked worriedly. Tony let out a half-hearted laugh.

“Always.” You tried wiggling out of the restraints, but they only seemed to tighten the more you struggled. “Stop moving, they’ll only get tighter.” Tony said.

“What? No we can’t just stay here!” You whisper yell, trying not to get the attention of the guy by the door.

“Well the more you struggle the worse it will get, just calm down.” Tony told you calmly, knowing if his words were harsh you’d panic.

“I can’t- I can’t use my powers-“ Your panicking.

“The cuffs are like the ones I have, they cut your powers.” Tony says.

“What are we going to do-your bleeding?!” You say panicked, your eye catching the gash on his arm.

“I’m fine, we’re fine.” He tells you.

“What?! Your fucking bleeding-“ Your sentence is cut off by a slap across your face.

“DONT FUCKING TOUCH HER!” Tony yelled as he struggled in the restraints. The man turned around facing Tony.

“What did I say about talking?” The man said with a smirk.

“I don’t give a fuck, I said don’t fucking touch her!” Tony yelled, words laced with anger. You moved your jaw, shaking off the pain.

“Your not one to make the calls here, Mr. Stark.” The man said as he held Tony’s face in his hand. Tony struggled in his grip, but the man didn’t budge.

“Leave him alone!” You yelled, making the man smile mischievously.

“Oh, your much like your father.” He said making his way to you. Tony felt his blood boil the closer the man got to you. The mans fingers caressed your cheek, you moved your head away from his hand in disgust. “So pretty.”

“Leave her ALONE!” Tony yelled, but before he could say anything more, the man held his hand up and in seconds another man that you hadn’t noticed before, came behind Tony, wrapping a restraint around his mouth. Tony yelled more but his voice was muffled.

“Silence him.” The man in front of you said, the other man responded by hitting him against the head. Tony winced in pain, and shut up.

“He’s pretty protective over you, ain’t he.” The man said his face coming closer to you.

“You needa mint.” You said, as your nose scrunched up. The man laughed, but slapped you across the face once again, this time making your cheek bleed.

“You should learn to keep that pretty mouth shut.” You opened and closed your mouth checking if your jaw was fine. After the man saw you were silent he moved away from you going over to the second man.

“What are we gonna do now?” The second man said.

“We wait for Him, he’s on his way.” The other answered.

Tony looked at you, eyes wide.

“I’m fine.” You mouthed to him, he nodded. But he knew you were far from fine.

“It’s been a week, and you still haven’t found anything?” Steve asked Bruce frustrated.

“No I’m working on it.” Bruce said typing on the multiple screens. Steve paced around the room, rubbing his face. Nat stood up from her spot.

“We’ll find them, don’t worry.” Nat said softly. Steve looked up at Nat the frustration building up.”cmere.” Nat said opening her arms for Steve, which he gladly took.

“Steve I’ve got something.” Bruce said as she turned the screen so Steve could see. “Its the security tapes, the truck left the city, it’s all the way up in Maine-“ Bruce said but was cut of by Peter.

“Then what are we waiting for!” Peter was sitting by Bruce his fifth coffee in hand.

“Hold on Pete, you need to rest.” Steve said putting an arm on Peters shoulder, but Peter just pushed him away.

“What?! I’m fine-“ Peter was actually fine. When he heard the bomb he ran down to the lab to find the guys taking you away and when he yelled one guy had shot him with a taser. But he was fine now.

“We’re not going to take you, we don’t know what’s out there and if Tony finds out we took you to something we didn’t know-“ Peters eyes were wide.

“I’m going whether you like it or not, I’m the only one here who’s seen how they look and I’m not going to just sit here and do nothing!” Peter felt his blood boil, his fists clenching. Steve looked back at the rest of the team to see what they think.

“He’s not a kid anymore, he can handle it.” Sam said shrugging. Steve turned back to Peter, looking over him. If he had to be honest, they were right Peter isn’t a kid anymore.

“Fine, but your staying with us, don’t go off on your own.” Steve said sternly. Peter nodded frantically.

“Of course.” Steve patted his shoulder once more and turned back to the team.

“Suit up!”

-

You woke up once again, this time after passing out four times. Both you and Tony were covered in blood, bruises and deep gashes littered your bodies. You held back the tears, not wanting to show weakness. And you knew if you broke down, that Tony would too. The only reason he’s still breathing right now is for you.

“Screw. You.” You said spitting your blood in the mans face. The man yelled again, punching your gut this time. You groaned in pain, arching forward.

“Leave her alone.” Tony groaned, it was getting harder and harder for him to speak. Unlike you, Tony was human, he didn’t have any super strength or fast healing, it was getting worse. The man got up fixing his shirt. He traded spots with the other man. And well let’s put it in a not so gory way, he had a sharp knife. 

You screamed out in pain, Tony closing his eyes shut as the tears fell from the sides of his eyes. He couldn’t bare to look at you being tortured. After some time the screams died down and both men walked out of the room. Tony finally opened his eyes to find you once again, fainted and laying your head to the side. 

“I’m sorry.” He whispered between sobs. 

Next day

You don’t know how much blood you’ve lost, but you know it’s a lot considering how light-headed your are, and the passing out. The two men walked back into the room, but they’re facial expressions were different then before. 

“We’re down to our last straw, tell us the codes!” The man yelled at you both.

“You mind keeping your voice a little down, my head kinda hurts.” You teased with a stupid smirk. Tony shook his head at you, letting out a sigh when he saw the man charge over to you. 

“Don’t-” Tony was cut off when the man held his hand up. He leaned down, his face inches away from yours.

“You think your funny, don’t you?” He said seriously. You shrugged giving him a sly smirk. 

“I’d like to think.” The man turned around looking at his buddy, then back to you. A humorless laugh leaving his lips. You were expecting him to slap, punch, kick anything, but no, all he did was put a hand up. Before you know it, two people walk in, faces covered in masks. Both men go to Tony untying him and taking him away. 

“Where are you taking him!” You yelled as Tony tried to fight them off, but the amount of blood he lost making him more weak. 

“You should’ve stayed quiet.” He said, walking out of the room and leaving you alone. 

The next few hours were quiet, but then you heard a sharp yell. Your head picked up, you heard it again and again. Tony. You winced hearing his cries and screams. You felt the tears running down your cheek. It’s your fault, it’s your fault. There hurting him. You heard various noises, but they all ended in his screams. And that’s when you lost it. 

You cried more and more, your heart clenching every time you heard his screams and before you know it your hands were heating up. With one more cry the restraints came burning off and you fell to the ground. You cried more, until your head finally came back. You stood up, holding the chair for balance. You took a few deep breaths, trying to calm yourself. But soon enough, you were back, lighting your hands with energy and blasting the steel door open. 

You walked down the hallway, soon hearing footsteps running in your direction. You didn’t bother, when you saw the familiar suits you blasted them, taking your time to let the energy enter there bodies and blow them from the inside out. You had no mercy and you didn’t care. The more you walked, the clearer his screams became, but then they ended. You stopped in your tracks, your heartbeat quickening. You ran to the door you heard him last. 

You burned a hole in the door, entering the dark room. The moment yours eyes scanned over the room, your heart broke. They had Tony wrapped up, standing up, as two men beat him and tortured him with tools. Tony wasn’t moving. You shook your head. He’s not dead. no no. The men came charging towards you. You took each one of them, dropping them to the ground and pressing a hand on there chests burning the energy through there body. the only thing you could hear was your heart beat. 

You ran to Tony, burning off the restraints, his body falling on you, you held him, laying him on the floor. He rested on you as you cried. 

“Tony, please, please wake up.” You were choking on sobs. Your hand stroking his bloody face. You leaned your forehead down on his as your tears fell on him. “D-daddy, w-wake up, I need you. I need you.” You couldn’t feel anything, only the shattering of your heart. “please.” Your body shook, letting all the feeling in. 

-

The team split up, taking different parts of the building. 

By the time they all got in, they heard blasting and screams. Steve, Nat and Peter made their way through the buildings. After taking down most of the soliders, they went to each room, looking for you and Tony. 

Not long after, Peter turned a corner to hear your cries. He ran quickly and stopped in his tracks when he saw you clutching Tony’s body. “I-I’m sorry.” He heard you cry. Steve and Nat stopped next to Peter, both their hearts dropping. 

Peter didn’t waste time running to you. Your eyes shot up, locking with Peter. Peter sat on the other side of Tony, his hand on his chest. 

“Karen check his vitals.” You continued to stroke Tonys hair, as you waited. “He’s alive, his heart beat is very slow though. We need to get him back to the compound.” He said quickly looking up at Steve. Steve nodded going over to Tony. You looked up eyes wide. Steve struggled to get your grip off of Tony, you didn’t even know, he needed to get in the quinjet, but you couldn’t let go. 

“Y/n let go.” Steve said, but your eyes only teared up more.

“I can’t, I can’t.” You cried, shaking your head ‘no’. Steve looked over your figure. You were broken, you were truly holding on with all your strength. 

“Peter.” Steve looked at Peter, nodding his head to you. Peter nodded coming behind you, tugging your hands out of the grip. You cried louder when you lost contact with Tony. Steve picked Tony up, as Peter held you back. 

“He’s going to be fine. Your fine. We’re here.” Peter whispered in your ear, as you cried. You continued to cry, until Peter picked you up and carried you to the quinjet. 

You cried more when you saw Tony being hooked up to multiple wire on the jet. Peter made you turn away, and soon enough the crying was too much and you fell asleep. 

-three days later

You groaned as you started to wake up, not in a hard chair, but a comfortable bed. Your eyes fluttered open, the sunlight’s streaking in through the window. Your eyes landed on Peter who was fastly asleep. head on your bed, hand holding yours. You brought your hand up, rubbing it smoothly through his curls.

Peter groaned, yawning as he picked up his head. When he finally opened his eyes, it seemed like you could finally breathe. “Hey.” You whisper, smiling brightly at him. Peter doesn’t waste time, leaning into your body and capturing your lips. You smiled into the kiss, cupping his cheek. Peter pulled away resting his head on yours.

“Hey.” He whispered back.

After the doctors ran a few more check ups on you, and made sure you were ok to leave the room. You had Peter take you to Tony’s room.

Your heart clutched when you entered the room seeing Tony hooked up to machines, his breathing steady.

“He hasn’t woken up yet.” Peter tells you softly. You nod, moving over to the seat by the bed.

“I’m just-I’m just gonna sit with him.” You say softly. Peter nods bending down to kiss the top of your head.

“I’ll be outside if you need anything. You give Peter a warm smile, turning back to Tony. You let your hand take his, smoothing your thumb on the back of his hand.

“I’m sorry.” You whisper, leaning your head against the bed, a few tears escaping.

But even that wasn’t enough. You don’t notice how much you depend on a person, until you loose them. 

-

He felt his heart ease, you were alive. Tony couldn’t hold back the smile and the tears prickling his eyes. His hand came out from under yours, softly caressing your cheek, you sighing in your sleep. 

You began to wake up, you became a pretty light sleeper after the incident. You groaned tiredly, opening your eyes softly. As soon as you caught a glimpse of Tony with his eyes open, yours shot open. Your head picking up. You felt the weight on your heart being lifted. Tony smiled when he saw your content face.

Not long after, Peter turned a corner to hear your cries. He ran quickly and stopped in his tracks when he saw you clutching Tony’s body. “I-I’m sorry.” He heard you cry. Steve and Nat stopped next to Peter, both their hearts dropping. 

Peter didn’t waste time running to you. Your eyes shot up, locking with Peter. Peter sat on the other side of Tony, his hand on his chest. 

“Karen check his vitals.” You continued to stroke Tonys hair, as you waited. “He’s alive, his heart beat is very slow though. We need to get him back to the compound.” He said quickly looking up at Steve. Steve nodded going over to Tony. You looked up eyes wide. Steve struggled to get your grip off of Tony, you didn’t even know, he needed to get in the quinjet, but you couldn’t let go. 

“Y/n let go.” Steve said, but your eyes only teared up more.

“I can’t, I can’t.” You cried, shaking your head ‘no’. Steve looked over your figure. You were broken, you were truly holding on with all your strength. 

“Peter.” Steve looked at Peter, nodding his head to you. Peter nodded coming behind you, tugging your hands out of the grip. You cried louder when you lost contact with Tony. Steve picked Tony up, as Peter held you back. 

“He’s going to be fine. Your fine. We’re here.” Peter whispered in your ear, as you cried. You continued to cry, until Peter picked you up and carried you to the quinjet. 

You cried more when you saw Tony being hooked up to multiple wire on the jet. Peter made you turn away, and soon enough the crying was too much and you fell asleep. 

-three days later

You groaned as you started to wake up, not in a hard chair, but a comfortable bed. Your eyes fluttered open, the sunlight’s streaking in through the window. Your eyes landed on Peter who was fastly asleep. head on your bed, hand holding yours. You brought your hand up, rubbing it smoothly through his curls.

Peter groaned, yawning as he picked up his head. When he finally opened his eyes, it seemed like you could finally breathe. “Hey.” You whisper, smiling brightly at him. Peter doesn’t waste time, leaning into your body and capturing your lips. You smiled into the kiss, cupping his cheek. Peter pulled away resting his head on yours.

“Hey.” He whispered back.

After the doctors ran a few more check ups on you, and made sure you were ok to leave the room. You had Peter take you to Tony’s room.

Your heart clutched when you entered the room seeing Tony hooked up to machines, his breathing steady.

“He hasn’t woken up yet.” Peter tells you softly. You nod, moving over to the seat by the bed.

“I’m just-I’m just gonna sit with him.” You say softly. Peter nods bending down to kiss the top of your head.

“I’ll be outside if you need anything. You give Peter a warm smile, turning back to Tony. You let your hand take his, smoothing your thumb on the back of his hand.

“I’m sorry.” You whisper, leaning your head against the bed, a few tears escaping.

-

You spent the next couple of weeks by his side, only getting up to use the bathroom. Either Peter or Steve would come by to give you some food, but you’d only have a bite or two. You spent most of your time talking to Tony, well you hope he could hear you, or you’d just be talking to yourself. You were trying your best to keep it together. There were a few nights where you’d cry because it was driving you crazy. You could feel yourself slipping off the edge, but Peter kept you up, and so did the rest of the time. But even that wasn’t enough. You don’t notice how much you depend on a person, until you loose them. 

-

You were once again, sleeping by Tony’s side, resting your head on the bed, hand softly placed on top of his. It was the middle of the night and Steve had tried once again to get you to sleep in your room, but you refused. 

Tony felt himself stir awake, his eyes slowly opening, still feeling the weight of them however. His eyes scanning the dark room, tilting his head a little, then landing on you. He felt his heart ease, you were alive. Tony couldn’t hold back the smile and the tears prickling his eyes. His hand came out from under yours, softly caressing your cheek, you sighing in your sleep. 

You began to wake up, you became a pretty light sleeper after the incident. You groaned tiredly, opening your eyes softly. As soon as you caught a glimpse of Tony with his eyes open, yours shot open. Your head picking up. You felt the weight on your heart being lifted. Tony smiled when he saw your content face. 

“Hey kid.” He said softly. You broke down, letting the tears coat your cheeks as you flung your arms around his waist resting your on his shoulder. Tony let the tears run down his cheek as well, rubbing your back. 

“Dad.” You felt the words leaving your lips easily, not forced or strangled. They were right. “Your awake.” You sniffled, as Tony picked your head up, wiping the tears from your cheeks. 

“I’m here.” You let out a soft laugh, followed by more tears. 

“I’m sorry.” You cried as Tony pulled you back in. 

“Don’t be sorry. Your fine. I’m fine. Your not alone.” You clutched Tony’s shirt as you held him closely. “I love you y/n, your my baby. You’ll always be my baby.” Tony said softly, as your cries eased. 

“Love you too Dad.” You replied. Tony felt his heart leap when he heard the three letter word leave your lips. You finally said it, you accepted it and he was going to be there. He was going to be the best father out there, because your his daughter and he’d be damned if he lets you live your life on your own. And your okay with letting him.

-

-

Part 9

(Peter Parker x reader)

Summary: Reader lives a hard life, jumping from foster home to foster home, only staying in NYC though. The reader is a mutant, no one wanted her, and it’s not like she could contain her powers. But in her efforts to steal a famous suit, she ends up getting caught. Her path going in a different direction.

Warning: Language, angst, fluff, violence,

Word count: 3K

A/N: Guys I feel so bad, legit I kept procrastinating this last part. But I finally finished the series, and I think I might start a new one but Tom Holland. I’m just so happy for those of you who actually read this series and enjoy it. Thanks for sticking with me :)

“Wake up!” You heard someone yell then you felt ice water hit your face. Your eyes snapped open, you vision was blurry and you heard a ringing. Soon your eyes focused on the man in front of you. “It’s about damn fucking time.” He said roughly, moving away to the door to talk to someone.

Your eyes adjusted to the dull light and that’s when you could make out the person sitting in front of you, also tied down to the chair.

“Tony?” Your voice was scratched but he heard you.

“It’s me.” Tony coughed harshly, spitting blood out of his mouth. “Are you alright?”

“Always. Are you?” You asked worriedly. Tony let out a half-hearted laugh.

“Always.” You tried wiggling out of the restraints, but they only seemed to tighten the more you struggled. “Stop moving, they’ll only get tighter.” Tony said.

“What? No we can’t just stay here!” You whisper yell, trying not to get the attention of the guy by the door.

“Well the more you struggle the worse it will get, just calm down.” Tony told you calmly, knowing if his words were harsh you’d panic.

“I can’t- I can’t use my powers-“ Your panicking.

“The cuffs are like the ones I have, they cut your powers.” Tony says.

“What are we going to do-your bleeding?!” You say panicked, your eye catching the gash on his arm.

“I’m fine, we’re fine.” He tells you.

“What?! Your fucking bleeding-“ Your sentence is cut off by a slap across your face.

“DONT FUCKING TOUCH HER!” Tony yelled as he struggled in the restraints. The man turned around facing Tony.

“What did I say about talking?” The man said with a smirk.

“I don’t give a fuck, I said don’t fucking touch her!” Tony yelled, words laced with anger. You moved your jaw, shaking off the pain.

“Your not one to make the calls here, Mr. Stark.” The man said as he held Tony’s face in his hand. Tony struggled in his grip, but the man didn’t budge.

“Leave him alone!” You yelled, making the man smile mischievously.

“Oh, your much like your father.” He said making his way to you. Tony felt his blood boil the closer the man got to you. The mans fingers caressed your cheek, you moved your head away from his hand in disgust. “So pretty.”

“Leave her ALONE!” Tony yelled, but before he could say anything more, the man held his hand up and in seconds another man that you hadn’t noticed before, came behind Tony, wrapping a restraint around his mouth. Tony yelled more but his voice was muffled.

“Silence him.” The man in front of you said, the other man responded by hitting him against the head. Tony winced in pain, and shut up.

“He’s pretty protective over you, ain’t he.” The man said his face coming closer to you.

“You needa mint.” You said, as your nose scrunched up. The man laughed, but slapped you across the face once again, this time making your cheek bleed.

“You should learn to keep that pretty mouth shut.” You opened and closed your mouth checking if your jaw was fine. After the man saw you were silent he moved away from you going over to the second man.

“What are we gonna do now?” The second man said.

“We wait for Him, he’s on his way.” The other answered.

Tony looked at you, eyes wide.

“I’m fine.” You mouthed to him, he nodded. But he knew you were far from fine.

-

“It’s been a week, and you still haven’t found anything?” Steve asked Bruce frustrated.

“No I’m working on it.” Bruce said typing on the multiple screens. Steve paced around the room, rubbing his face. Nat stood up from her spot.

“We’ll find them, don’t worry.” Nat said softly. Steve looked up at Nat the frustration building up.”cmere.” Nat said opening her arms for Steve, which he gladly took.

-two weeks and a half later

“Steve I’ve got something.” Bruce said as she turned the screen so Steve could see. “Its the security tapes, the truck left the city, it’s all the way up in Maine-“ Bruce said but was cut of by Peter.

“Then what are we waiting for!” Peter was sitting by Bruce his fifth coffee in hand.

“Hold on Pete, you need to rest.” Steve said putting an arm on Peters shoulder, but Peter just pushed him away.

“What?! I’m fine-“ Peter was actually fine. When he heard the bomb he ran down to the lab to find the guys taking you away and when he yelled one guy had shot him with a taser. But he was fine now.

“We’re not going to take you, we don’t know what’s out there and if Tony finds out we took you to something we didn’t know-“ Peters eyes were wide.

“I’m going whether you like it or not, I’m the only one here who’s seen how they look and I’m not going to just sit here and do nothing!” Peter felt his blood boil, his fists clenching. Steve looked back at the rest of the team to see what they think.

“He’s not a kid anymore, he can handle it.” Sam said shrugging. Steve turned back to Peter, looking over him. If he had to be honest, they were right Peter isn’t a kid anymore.

“Fine, but your staying with us, don’t go off on your own.” Steve said sternly. Peter nodded frantically.

“Of course.” Steve patted his shoulder once more and turned back to the team.

“Suit up!”

-

You woke up once again, this time after passing out four times. Both you and Tony were covered in blood, bruises and deep gashes littered your bodies. You held back the tears, not wanting to show weakness. And you knew if you broke down, that Tony would too. The only reason he’s still breathing right now is for you.

“Screw. You.” You said spitting your blood in the mans face. The man yelled again, punching your gut this time. You groaned in pain, arching forward.

“Leave her alone.” Tony groaned, it was getting harder and harder for him to speak. Unlike you, Tony was human, he didn’t have any super strength or fast healing, it was getting worse. The man got up fixing his shirt. He traded spots with the other man. And well let’s put it in a not so gory way, he had a sharp knife. 

You screamed out in pain, Tony closing his eyes shut as the tears fell from the sides of his eyes. He couldn’t bare to look at you being tortured. After some time the screams died down and both men walked out of the room. Tony finally opened his eyes to find you once again, fainted and laying your head to the side. 

“I’m sorry.” He whispered between sobs. 

Next day

You don’t know how much blood you’ve lost, but you know it’s a lot considering how light-headed your are, and the passing out. The two men walked back into the room, but they’re facial expressions were different then before. 

“We’re down to our last straw, tell us the codes!” The man yelled at you both.

“You mind keeping your voice a little down, my head kinda hurts.” You teased with a stupid smirk. Tony shook his head at you, letting out a sigh when he saw the man charge over to you. 

“Don’t-” Tony was cut off when the man held his hand up. He leaned down, his face inches away from yours.

“You think your funny, don’t you?” He said seriously. You shrugged giving him a sly smirk. 

“I’d like to think.” The man turned around looking at his buddy, then back to you. A humorless laugh leaving his lips. You were expecting him to slap, punch, kick anything, but no, all he did was put a hand up. Before you know it, two people walk in, faces covered in masks. Both men go to Tony untying him and taking him away. 

“Where are you taking him!” You yelled as Tony tried to fight them off, but the amount of blood he lost making him more weak. 

“You should’ve stayed quiet.” He said, walking out of the room and leaving you alone. 

The next few hours were quiet, but then you heard a sharp yell. Your head picked up, you heard it again and again. Tony. You winced hearing his cries and screams. You felt the tears running down your cheek. It’s your fault, it’s your fault. There hurting him. You heard various noises, but they all ended in his screams. And that’s when you lost it. 

You cried more and more, your heart clenching every time you heard his screams and before you know it your hands were heating up. With one more cry the restraints came burning off and you fell to the ground. You cried more, until your head finally came back. You stood up, holding the chair for balance. You took a few deep breaths, trying to calm yourself. But soon enough, you were back, lighting your hands with energy and blasting the steel door open. 

You walked down the hallway, soon hearing footsteps running in your direction. You didn’t bother, when you saw the familiar suits you blasted them, taking your time to let the energy enter there bodies and blow them from the inside out. You had no mercy and you didn’t care. The more you walked, the clearer his screams became, but then they ended. You stopped in your tracks, your heartbeat quickening. You ran to the door you heard him last. 

You burned a hole in the door, entering the dark room. The moment yours eyes scanned over the room, your heart broke. They had Tony wrapped up, standing up, as two men beat him and tortured him with tools. Tony wasn’t moving. You shook your head. He’s not dead. no no. The men came charging towards you. You took each one of them, dropping them to the ground and pressing a hand on there chests burning the energy through there body. the only thing you could hear was your heart beat. 

You ran to Tony, burning off the restraints, his body falling on you, you held him, laying him on the floor. He rested on you as you cried. 

“Tony, please, please wake up.” You were choking on sobs. Your hand stroking his bloody face. You leaned your forehead down on his as your tears fell on him. “D-daddy, w-wake up, I need you. I need you.” You couldn’t feel anything, only the shattering of your heart. “please.” Your body shook, letting all the feeling in. 

-

body:
MCU Future Idea

After people find out Peter is Spider-Man, villains like to go after Ned and MJ

Ned is very hard to get to, and people think heteronormatively so they go after MJ anyways.

So, like, imagine Peter as a professor somewhere, and in the middle of class, he gets a call that he answers and they’re like ‘we have MJ come get her type obvious trap stuff

And Peter, instead of being super worried like expected asks 'How long have you had her?’

He gets an answer, nods a moment, then says, good luck, and hangs up just as alarms start blaring on the kidnappers side.

Why?

You really think MJ would pass up the opportunity to train with Natasha Romanoff, especially is people are gonna start trying to kidnap her?

MJ shows up an hour later in Peter’s class and Peter only looks up to be like 'hm… quicker than last time. Good job.’

'Only two guards that I met the entire way, honestly, it’s a little insulting.’

“H-hold on, t-t-they’re c-coming, okay?” and  “You don’t get to quit on me!” AND we’re gonna add in #9,  “Please, please, wake up. I can’t do this without you.”
This is an AU of Infinity War. What if Tony was stabbed and he didn’t have the means to heal it up like he did and Strange still gives up the time stone. 

Red. It was all red.

Peter was shaking as he pressed his hands against his stomach, hoping to at least slow the bleeding down a bit. 

“P-Pete,” Tony whispered with a grunt. “Stop.” 

“You’re gonna be okay,” Peter told him. “Just hang in there.” He looked over his shoulder and shouted, “I need help! Please!” 

They were all just standing there. Even the Doctor guy. Wasn’t he a real doctor? Didn’t he have magic powers? Couldn’t he fix this? 

“Peter, I don’t think– I don’t think I’m gonna make it,” Tony said, staring up with glassy eyes. 

“Don’t,” Peter said. “Don’t you dare say that.” 

Tony chuckled, blood trailing from the corner of his mouth. He didn’t argue it again. Peter turned back to the hole in his stomach, watching helplessly as more and more blood continued to seep out through his fingers. 

This was all to familiar to the night he lost Ben. Ben bled out on the ground in front of him and no matter how Peter covered the wound or begged him not to go…he still did. 

“Please don’t…” Die? Follow Ben? Leave me alone? 

“I love you, kid, but I think it’s time for me to tap out.” 

The tears that had been building up in his eyes started to fall. “No, please,” he sobbed. “You don’t get to quit on me!” He couldn’t lose another father-figure. 

“Not quitting, Pete. I’d never quit on you.” Tony’s voice was too low for his liking. “I know you’re gonna be the best. With or without me.” 

Peter shook his head, bringing a hand up to wipe the tears from his face. He realized a little too late that only smudged Tony’s blood across his cheek. “I can’t do it without you. I know I can’t.” 

“‘Course you can, buddy.” Tony’s chest was rising and falling slower as the seconds passed.

“H-hold on, t-t-they’re c-coming, okay?” Peter wasn’t sure who he was talking about. They were stranded here and half the guardians were somewhere else on this planet and the ones here couldn’t help. The Avengers at home didn’t even know where they were or that Tony needed help.

“It’s okay. It’s okay,” Tony whispered. “So proud of you, kiddo. Always was even if I wasn’t too good at saying so.” 

“Don’t–.” 

“You’re gonna do amazing things. I know it. Remember though, don’t do anything I would do and…” 

“Don’t do anything you wouldn’t do.” 

“Exactly, bud. You got it.” 

“P-Please don’t leave me…”

“Love you, Pe–.” 

Before Tony could finish his name, he was gone. 

Peter shook him gently. “Mr. Stark?” No response. He shook him a little rougher. “Mr. Stark!” Peter sobbed, falling forward, his head resting on Tony’s chest.  “Please, please, wake up. I can’t do this without you.”

A second later, he shot up when his spidey senses went off. Something was wrong. Something was happening. He looked around for the danger and saw just behind him, the others fading to nothing more than dust. 

They were gone. 
And he was next. 

Maybe he would have fought it. Maybe if Tony were there to hold him here, he wouldn’t disappear in the wind. 

But Tony wasn’t here. 

And now, maybe Peter didn’t have to do this without him. 


He faded away with a smile on his face.

summary: Might I just say that Identity Theft is one of, if not THE best Irondad-Spiderson fics ever written, and that all other...
question: Might I just say that Identity Theft is one of, if not THE best Irondad-Spiderson fics ever written, and that all other Irondad-Spiderson writers should admire and respect you and treat you like royalty???
answer:
Oh wow! This is a compliment above all compliments. From the very bottom of my burst-with-love heart, thank you!

But please, share the love with the Irondad fandom! This community has some of the most creative, kind-hearted, thoughtful individuals I know and each and every one helped inspired me to write the beast that is Identity Theft.

@cinnamon-toast-cronch gave me a love for soft bring’em’backs with a fluffy piece about a well-loved stuffed Big Bird in Five and One

@jbsforever taught me that Tony and Peter can still be realistically distant and yet form a close bond with the beautiful and angsty it’ll be over (and I’ll still be asking when)

@captainkirkk gave me an unhealthy and obsessive fondness of Avenger fam with In the Home

@too-many-bees showed me Tony can still be a pissy-annoyed adult and Peter a irresponsible-pissy-teen and they can both still find their way back to each other with Let’s Kick It

@iron–spider gave me an unhealthy amount of love for Irondad fluff with pieces like Stark’s Home for Wayward Animals, and 5 times Peter is stuck with Tony

@losingmymindtonight gave me an unexpected desire for paternal Tony with And You’ll Blow Us All Away

@yellowdistress increased that desire for paternal Tony and took me along for a crazy ride with All the Devils are Here and The Root is Expectation

@caraminha showed me how to realistically write a panicked Tony and best of all, plant a seed for thankful May as opposed to angry May with The Primary Reason Tony Stark Would Throw Down With an Anti-Vaxxer in the Street 

signofthree/Uncertainty_Principle sparked a flame for Tony + team searching for missing Peter in Four Days – RIP you beautiful piece of work

eva7673 easily became the reason for my love of protective Tony with Give him back to me, or so help me god and 5 Times Peter Fell, and Tony caught him. And the 1 Time Tony didn’t.

@dragonnan simply showed her glorious presence and had me fangirling for weeks over my idol noticing something I wrote, easily removing any doubt that I’d be able to go as far as I have with the story.

@shoyzz-art, @dragonnan and @speakerunfolding for their mind-blowingly awesome art they’ve taken precious time of their day to draw and inspire me even further.

Plus, the whumpers in the fandom? @wordscorrupt @parkrstark, @whumphoarder , @edema–ruh

, @wolfypuppypiles, @agib-2002

– the list goes on and on. So many people, all these people, are the reason I was inspired to write Identity Theft. Share the love with them, because I would never have even started the fic without any of their amazing works.

blog.name: myfavoriteshadeofgray
blog.title: Charcoal Lynx
blog.description: Basically just my (unpopular) opinion and headcannons, all fandom based. If you don't like something you see, feel free to leave.

summary: I'm sorry but the leap of faith scene from into the spiderverse was not only the best part of the movie but probably the best...
body:
I’m sorry but the leap of faith scene from into the spiderverse was not only the best part of the movie but probably the best scene of anything I saw in 2018. It told a better story in two and half minutes then some movie do all together.

Miles’ remembering he’s family (and Peter) encouraging him as he makes his way to the building (like a pep talk). Him breaking the glass as he jumps because he still hasn’t gotten use to his powers yet, he has to relax to unstick he’s scared but he jumps anyway. The flashback to aunt Mays, where he finally get a suit (and web shooters) that fit him instead of one that’s to big for him. The way he goes from tumbling down at first before he straightens himself out. The flip perspective of Miles rising to meet he’s new role of protecting the city instead of falling. He starts moving and swing in his own style (not like Peter or Gwen). Some of the shot even reflect his failed attempts earlier in the movie. The music for the scene was amazing, using prowlers theme just added another layer. And Miles’ comic joining the others at the end.

Seriously best piece of cinema of all of 2018.

I’m sorry but the leap of faith scene from into the spiderverse was not only the best part of the movie but probably the best scene of anything I saw in 2018. It told a better story in two and half minutes then some movie do all together.

Miles’ remembering he’s family (and Peter) encouraging him as he makes his way to the building (like a pep talk). Him breaking the glass as he jumps because he still hasn’t gotten use to his powers yet, he has to relax to unstick he’s scared but he jumps anyway. The flashback to aunt Mays, where he finally get a suit (and web shooters) that fit him instead of one that’s to big for him. The way he goes from tumbling down at first before he straightens himself out. The flip perspective of Miles rising to meet he’s new role of protecting the city instead of falling. He starts moving and swing in his own style (not like Peter or Gwen). Some of the shot even reflect his failed attempts earlier in the movie. The music for the scene was amazing, using prowlers theme just added another layer. And Miles’ comic joining the others at the end.

Seriously best piece of cinema of all of 2018.

summary: imagine: peter parker | fic a day #22 | masterlist ↳ tagging: @pantasticalcat @hermione-is-my-queen @imabookworm31  @royallyslow...
body:
imagine: peter parker | fic a day #22 | masterlist
↳ tagging: @pantasticalcat @hermione-is-my-queen @imabookworm31  @royallyslow @izzy10718 @guys-wanna-fight

Imagine: your birthday is coming up. Excited you invite your friends to your house for your birthday party. To your despair, no one shows up but Peter. An hour after you decided to wait for them, you apologized to Peter for making him wait and decided to shut the party down, planning to mope for the rest of your life. Peter refuses to leave and let you wallow in your own pity and instead invites his friends over to celebrate your birthday with you. Not even half an hour later, his friends show up, donning gifts and pledging to show you what real friends are. The stay true to what they said and show you the best birthday ever.

summary: Petey Parker.... he was like... assigned a kin right?
body:
Petey Parker…. he was like… assigned a kin right?

He’s spiderkin but not self ascribed spiderkin. So like the universe assigned his kin?

And he just went with it? Fully dedicated himself to the aesthetic?

What a guy, what a great weird spiderguy.

title: The Saving of Greer Lilian
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2tqZhwP

by W01FS0NG

After, everything, everyone went their separate ways. Peter is in 10th grade, so are Ilan and Charlie. Sam and Dean are still hunting, Sharon is still a SHIELD agent, and Korra, Shota, Mel, and Tyra are still in Charles Xavier’s School For Gifted Youngers.
Sharon, as well as, everyone else, kept their eyes and ears open for anything concerning Lily or Jude. The day finally came a year later, October 14, 2015, when a lead came in.
Everyone got notified. They were just a few steps closer to getting them. Next, in January 2016, they figured out an exact location. Over time, they figured out the plan. Sharon would get to the control room. Sam and Dean would take care of the demons, and the mutants would take care of all the human cronies.
Then in early March 2016, everyone left to go to the Men of Letters bunker. From there, they’ll take a jet to where either Lily or Jude was being held.
